meanings.definition: A person who is easily taken advantage of or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: She always ended up as the patsy in their pranks.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a patsy when he realized he had been tricked.
meanings.sent3: Being the patsy in their jokes made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn is often the patsy sacrificed for the greater good.
meanings.sent5: The poor patsy never saw the trick coming.

meanings.sent1: He was used as a patsy to divert attention from the real culprit.
meanings.sent2: The patsy took the blame to protect his friends.
meanings.sent3: The patsy ended up being the hero of the story by taking the fall.
meanings.sent4: The patsy was like a shield, absorbing all the accusations.
meanings.sent5: The patsy was sacrificed to save the group from punishment.

meanings.definition: A person who is set up or framed for a crime.
meanings.sent1: He was framed and used as a patsy by the true criminals.
meanings.sent2: The patsy had no idea he was being set up for the crime.
meanings.sent3: The patsy's innocence was so obvious, it was comical.
meanings.sent4: The patsy was like a pawn in their criminal game.
meanings.sent5: The patsy was the perfect target for their scheme.
